content.html: More and more time pass, more views my blog has and less and less webmention I get. They are dying? Or what? Do you have any idea about it? #webmention #indieweb (https://fundor333.com/micro/2025/06/webmention-is-dying-/)
content.text:
More and more time pass, more views my blog has and less and less webmention I get. They are dying? Or what? Do you have any idea about it?

#webmention #indieweb (https://fundor333.com/micro/2025/06/webmention-is-dying-/)

content.html:
@readbeanicecream
As all the spec, if you implement it is a hell of a task but you can also use existing services for webmention.

I also have a static site with webmention (and some article about it) and it is "easy" to implement (for a coder) but I understand that webmention is a tech thing not a muggle thing

summary.value: I think the problem is not that webmentions are not used enough, but that people in general have still not left all the centralized walled gardens to build their personal web presences with which they could make better use of webmentions and comparable.

content.html:
I think the problem is not that webmentions are not used enough, but that people in general have still not left all the centralized walled gardens to build their personal web presences with which they could make better use of webmentions and comparable.

I think the fediverse/ActivityPub side of things is a step towards the right direction, but I think it is too easy to “just get on Mastodon” and leave it at that, in terms of leaving the walled-gardens.

And oh hey, you got me off my butt and to go and fix some things in my webmentions implementation before I could write this reply to you, so thanks. 😅
content.text:
I think the problem is not that webmentions are not used enough, but that people in general have still not left all the centralized
walled gardens to build their personal web presences with which they could make better use of webmentions and comparable.
I think the fediverse/ActivityPub side of things is a step towards the right direction, but I think it is too
easy to “just get on Mastodon” and leave it at that, in terms of leaving the walled-gardens.
And oh hey, you got me off my butt and to go and fix some things in my webmentions implementation before I
could write this reply to you, so thanks. 😅

summary.value:
No, I don’t think it is. I do think that we WebMention users need to find each other a little more.
In reply to Fundor333’s post, “Webmention Is Dying”
